overview_metadata.overview_description: In this lesson, students develop a piecewise function from a situation. They analyze a piecewise graph, creating a situation and piecewise function to represent the graph. Students analyze statements that correspond to different pieces of the graphed function. They then write a situation that a piecewise function could model, graph a partner's situation, and work with their partner to write a piecewise function for each.

overview_item_data_items: I can create graphs of linear piecewise functions.
I can write linear piecewise functions from situations, tables, and graphs.
I can interpret or write situations for a piecewise graph.
I can compare a linear absolute value function to a linear piecewise function.
A piecewise function is a function represented by more than one function, where each function corresponds to a specific part of the domain.
To write a piecewise function, you must write the equation and domain for each part of the function.
Represent piecewise functions using situations, equations, tables, and graphs.
It is possible to construct a linear absolute value function using a piecewise function.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students construct a linear piecewise graph from a situation.
